Coding and Matrix

Chapter 1.1 | Intro to complex numbers

Def | Field

A field is a set of elements equipped with a + operation and a x operation

Those operations satisfy
i.) Closure
∀x,y∈F\forall x, y \in F∀x,y∈F
a.)x+y∈Fa.) x+y \in Fa.)x+y∈F
b.)x⋅y∈Fb.) x\cdot y \in Fb.)x⋅y∈F

ii.) Commutative Property
a.)x+y=y+xa.) x+y = y+xa.)x+y=y+x
b.)x⋅y=y⋅xb.) x\cdot y = y\cdot xb.)x⋅y=y⋅x

iii.) Associative Property
a.)(x+y)+z=x+(y+z)a.) (x+y)+z = x + (y+z)a.)(x+y)+z=x+(y+z)
b.)(x⋅y)z=x(y⋅z)b.) (x\cdot y)z = x(y\cdot z)b.)(x⋅y)z=x(y⋅z)

iv.) Identity Element
a.)x+I+=xa.) x+I_{+} = xa.)x+I​+​​=x
b.)x⋅I×=xb.) x\cdot I_{\times} = xb.)x⋅I​×​​=x

v.) Inverse Element
a.)x+N+(x)=I+a.) x + N_{+}(x) = I_{+}a.)x+N​+​​(x)=I​+​​
b.)x⋅N×(x)=I×b.) x\cdot N_{\times}(x) = I_{\times}b.)x⋅N​×​​(x)=I​×​​

vi.) Distributive Property
c(a+b)=ac+bcc(a+b) = ac + bcc(a+b)=ac+bc

Example 1 | Verify that R\mathbb{R}R is a field

i.) ∀x,y∈R→x+y∈R\forall x,y\in\mathbb{R} \rightarrow x+y \in \mathbb{R}∀x,y∈R→x+y∈R ^ xy∈Rxy \in \mathbb{R}xy∈R
ii.) ∀x,y∈R→x+y=y+x\forall x,y\in\mathbb{R} \rightarrow x+y = y+x∀x,y∈R→x+y=y+x ^ xy=yxxy=yxxy=yx
iii.) Associative and so on

iv.) a.)x+0=xI+=0a.) x+0 = x\qquad I_{+}=0a.)x+0=xI​+​​=0
b.)x×1=xI×=0\quad b.) x\times 1 = x\qquad I_{\times}=0b.)x×1=xI​×​​=0

v.) a.)x+−x=0N+=−xa.) x+ -x = 0 \qquad N_{+}=-xa.)x+−x=0N​+​​=−x
b.)x+(1/x)=1N×=(1/x)\quad b.) x+ (1/x) = 1 \qquad N_{\times} = (1/x)b.)x+(1/x)=1N​×​​=(1/x)

Example 2 | Is Z\mathbb{Z}Z a field?

2∈Z2\in\mathbb{Z}2∈Z
2⋅(1/2)=1?2\cdot (1/2) = 1?2⋅(1/2)=1?
but 1/2∉Z so Z1/2 \notin \mathbb{Z}\space so\space \mathbb{Z}1/2∉Z so Z is not a field

Complex Numbers C\mathbb{C}C

The set of complex numbers C\mathbb{C}C consists of elements of the form
a+bi\qquad\qquad a+bia+bi
where a,b∈Ra,b\in\mathbb{R}a,b∈R and i2=−1i^2 = -1i​2​​=−1
a - real part
b - imaginary part

∗*∗operations
∙\bullet∙ Addition
(a+bi)+(c+di)(a+bi) + (c+di)(a+bi)+(c+di)
=(a+c)+(b+d)i=(a+c) + (b+d)i=(a+c)+(b+d)i \qquad (a+c)(a+c)(a+c) is real part (b+d)i\quad (b+d)i(b+d)i is imaginary part

∙\bullet∙ Multiplication
(a+bi)(c+di)=ac+adi+bci+bdi2(a+bi)(c+di) = ac+adi+bci+bdi^2(a+bi)(c+di)=ac+adi+bci+bdi​2​​
=(ac−bd)+(ad+bc)i=(ac-bd)+(ad+bc)i=(ac−bd)+(ad+bc)i

Example3Example 3Example3
a.)(6+3i)+(2−i)a.) (6+3i)+(2-i)a.)(6+3i)+(2−i)
=8+2i=8+2i=8+2i
b.)(3+2i)(7−5i)b.) (3+2i)(7-5i)b.)(3+2i)(7−5i)
=21−15i+14i−10i2=21-15i+14i-10i^2=21−15i+14i−10i​2​​
(21+10)+(−15+14)i(21+10)+(-15+14)i(21+10)+(−15+14)i
=31−i=31-i=31−i
c.)(6+3i)−(2−i)c.) (6+3i)-(2-i)c.)(6+3i)−(2−i)
=(6+3i)+(−(2−i))=(6+3i)+(-(2-i))=(6+3i)+(−(2−i))
=(6+3i)+(−2+i)=(6+3i)+(-2+i)=(6+3i)+(−2+i)
=(4+4i)=(4+4i)=(4+4i)

d.)(7+5i)(7−5i)d.) (7+5i)(7-5i)d.)(7+5i)(7−5i)
=74=74=74

In general: (a+bi)(a−bi)(a+bi)(a-bi)(a+bi)(a−bi)
=a2+b2+0i=a^2 + b^2 + 0i=a​2​​+b​2​​+0i

e.)(31−i)/(7−5i)=3+2ie.) (31-i)/(7-5i) = 3+2ie.)(31−i)/(7−5i)=3+2i
=(31−i)⋅(7+5i)(7+5i)=\frac {(31-i)\cdot(7+5i)}{(7+5i)}=​(7+5i)​​(31−i)⋅(7+5i)​​

=(217+5)+(155−7)i74=\frac {(217+5)+(155-7)i}{74}=​74​​(217+5)+(155−7)i​​

=222+148i74=174(222+148i)=\frac {222+148i}{74} = \frac{1}{74}(222+148i)=​74​​222+148i​​=​74​​1​​(222+148i)
=3+2i= 3+2i=3+2i

Note: C\mathbb{C}C is a field
